SourceBuffer.summary: The SourceBuffer interface represents a chunk of media to be passed into an and played, via a object. This can be made up of one or several media segments.

SourceBufferAbort.summary:
The abort() method of the
interface aborts the current segment and resets the segment parser.

SourceBufferAppendBuffer.summary:
The appendBuffer() method of the
interface appends media segment data from an
, a or a object
to the SourceBuffer.

SourceBufferAppendBufferAsync.summary:
CAUTION Non-standard The appendBufferAsync() method
of the interface begins the process of asynchronously
appending media segment data from an ,
a or a object to the SourceBuffer object.
It returns a which is fulfilled once the buffer has been appended.
SourceBufferAppendBufferAsync.returns:
A which is fulfilled when the buffer has been added successfully to the SourceBuffer object,
or null, if the request could not be initiated.

SourceBufferAppendWindowEnd.summary:
The appendWindowEnd property of the
interface controls the timestamp for the end of the append window, a
timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the
SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps within this range will be
appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.

remarks.para: The default value of appendWindowEnd is positive infinity.

SourceBufferAppendWindowEnd.value: A double, indicating the end time of the append window, in seconds.

SourceBufferAppendWindowStart.summary:
The appendWindowStart property of the
interface controls the timestamp for the start of the append window, a
timestamp range that can be used to filter what media data is appended to the
SourceBuffer. Coded media frames with timestamps within this range will be
appended, whereas those outside the range will be filtered out.

remarks.para:
The default value of appendWindowStart is the presentation start time,
which is the beginning time of the playable media.

SourceBufferAppendWindowStart.value: A double, indicating the start time of the append window, in seconds.

SourceBufferAudioTracks.summary:
The audioTracks read-only property of the
interface returns a list of the audio tracks currently
contained inside the SourceBuffer.

SourceBufferBuffered.summary:
The buffered read-only property of the
interface returns the time ranges that are currently
buffered in the SourceBuffer as a normalized
object.

SourceBufferChangeType.summary:
The changeType() method of the
interface sets the MIME type that future calls to
should expect the new media
data to conform to. This makes it possible to change codecs or container type
mid-stream.

remarks.para:
One scenario in which this is helpful is to support adapting the media source to
changing bandwidth availability, by transitioning from one codec to another as resource
constraints change.

SourceBufferMode.summary:
The mode property of the
interface controls whether media segments can be appended to the
SourceBuffer in any order, or in a strict sequence.

remarks.para:
The mode value is initially set when the SourceBuffer is created using
MediaSource.addSourceBuffer(). If timestamps already exist for the media
segments, then the value will be set to segments; if they don't, then the
value will be set to sequence.

If you try to set the mode property value to segments when
the initial value is sequence, an exception will be thrown. The existing
segment order must be maintained in sequence mode. You can, however, change
the value from segments to sequence. It just means the play
order will be fixed, and new timestamps generated to reflect this.

This property cannot be changed during while the SourceBuffer is
processing either an or
call.

SourceBufferRemove.summary:
The remove() method of the
interface removes media segments within a specific time range from the
SourceBuffer. This method can only be called when
equals false. If
SourceBuffer.updating is not equal to false, call
.

SourceBufferRemoveAsync.summary:
CAUTION Non-standard The removeAsync() method of the
interface starts the process of asynchronously removing
from the SourceBuffer media segments found within a specific time
range. A is returned, which is fulfilled when the buffers
in the specified time range have been removed.

remarks.para:
This method can only be called when is
false. If that's not the case, call instead.

SourceBufferRemoveAsync.returns:
A whose fulfillment handler is executed once the buffers in the
specified time range have been removed from the SourceBuffer.

SourceBufferTextTracks.summary:
NOTE Experimental The textTracks read-only property of the
interface returns a list of the text tracks currently
contained inside the SourceBuffer.

SourceBufferTimestampOffset.summary:
The timestampOffset property of the
interface controls the offset applied to timestamps inside
media segments that are appended to the SourceBuffer.

remarks.para: The initial value of timestampOffset is 0.

SourceBufferTimestampOffset.value: A double, with the offset amount expressed in seconds.

SourceBufferUpdating.summary:
The updating read-only property of the
interface indicates whether the SourceBuffer is
currently being updated â€” i.e., whether an or
operation is currently in progress.

SourceBufferVideoTracks.summary:
The videoTracks read-only property of the
interface returns a list of the video tracks currently
contained inside the SourceBuffer.
